etymology.description: 扌(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 見(见) (jiàn, "see") + 攴(攴) (pū, "tap") -> hand moving or stirring seen by striking -> final form of 搅
etymology.interpretation: The character 搅(攪) is formed from combining elements related to actions involving the hand and an object being manipulated, in this case, through tapping or stirring.
etymology.simplification: 攪(搅): Simplified by reducing the complexity of the component 見(见) (jiàn, "see") to 见.

examples.chinese: 他用勺子搅牛奶(他用勺子攪牛奶)。
examples.english: He stirs the milk with a spoon.

examples.chinese: 厨房里(廚房裡)，他搅拌汤料(他攪拌湯料)。
examples.pinyin: Chúfáng lǐ, tā jiǎo bàn tāng liào.
examples.english: In the kitchen, he stirs the soup ingredients.

examples.chinese: 暴风雨搅乱了小镇的平静(暴風雨攪亂了小鎮的平靜)。
examples.pinyin: Bàofēngyǔ jiǎo luànle xiǎozhèn de píngjìng.
examples.english: The storm stirred up the tranquility of the small town.
